intro: Indigofera erythrogramma subsp. erythrogramma, commonly known as the red-stemmed indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and trifoliate leaves with small, ovate leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to regions of Africa and is often found in open woodlands and savannas. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
